article_text:
WASHINGTON—Former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush on Monday said he is nearing a decision on whether to run for president and laid out a governing blueprint that could serve as the underpinnings of a 2016 campaign platform.

Mr. Bush, addressing The Wall Street Journal CEO Council annual meeting, ticked off his priorities: an “all-in” energy policy that expands the use of the nation’s natural resources; a reduction in business regulations; a...
